column5: Has all of Canada gone to the barbless hook regualations? Rumor of some returning fisherman said that there hooks were all taken at the border to include crank baits. I know there are certain areas which require barbless hooks but, I did not think all of Canada had this regulation. Also, has anyone had any trouble taking fresh meat or milk accross the border? Thanks for all the information.
In Ontario there are no barbless rules as far as I know. I live here so I wouldn't worry about it.

Funny how people start rumours? LOL.That is all untrue sure some Provinces your not allowed to USE Barbless hooks but you are still able to posess them,so who ever told you that story its not true. NMhttp://www.xtremesportfishing.com
As northern manitoban said, legal to possess in manitoba, but debarb before tying or snapping on. If you don't pinch them down before tying it on you may be the one getting pinched.
Dogtooth Lake is a barbless hook lake, near Kenora...I have been fishing there for 5 years.
